nodes.title: II.1. Stelae and accompanying structures: Funerary and non-funerary structures
General site characteristics
nodes.body: Donak DoringRdo nag rdo ring is located just east of a dark-colored rocky formation known as DonakRdo nag. DonakRdo nag sits on the eastern edge of the huge Drapye TsakhaGrab ye tshwa kha basin. A low saddle to he east admits morning sunlight between the summits of DonakRdo nag. The view to the west is extremely encompassing. The terrain is sandy and gently declines in a westerly direction. Donak DoringRdo nag rdo ring consists of two dark gray irregularly shaped pillars spaced 1 m apart. The pillars measure 70 cm (height) x 85 cm (basal girth) and 40 cm x 70 cm. These standing stones are heavily worn and are naturally polished, probably hrough the action of blowing sand. A few loose stones are scattered around the pillars.
